Class BankingSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wmich.cs1120.TThompson.LA1.BankingSystem

  • public class BankingSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    DateCreated: 01/14/16 DateDue: 01/27/16 Course: CS1120-543 Description: Banking System prototype. Program will load account data from a text file and allows the user to deposit, withdraw, view account balance, and transfer funds from the terminal.
    Author:
    Tyler Thompson

      • bankTeller

        public static void bankTeller(java.util.Scanner kb,
              java.lang.String action,
              java.util.ArrayList<Account> accounts,
              int accountNumber,
              double amount)
        Method handles deposits and withdraws. combines the deposit and withdraw methods show in the example
        Parameters:
        kb - keyboard scanner
        action - action to take, valid strings are: deposit | withdraw
        accounts - the arraylist that contains all the accounts and information
        accountNumber - account number to work with
        amount - amount of money to deposit or withdraw

        method validates input and returns false if input is not valid and true if the input is valid.
        Parameters:
        input - string containing the data you would like to verify
        validationType - the type of data you want to verify your input with. Accepted values are: integer | double | filelocation
